messages.message: Are we happy with students still having access after a certain point? If they ended up at one of our competitors this could put us at a serious disadvantage in the market

I think the answer to that is yes, we’ve always been committed to supporting the students in the few classes that get taught using Instabase. We’ve gotten feedback that students are quite excited to hear that they get to keep their accounts after the class. But I can let @Anant chime in in case we are deviating from this.

Could we remove any account that isn’t from a instabase.com (http://instabase.com) domain, or from a domain linked to one of our customers? If anyone outside of this wanted access, can we make another instance that students can use?

Agreed @Heymian that we should be supporting students in this. I would question whether they should keep their accounts after they finish school though. What was the rationale for it? Just very conscious of things falling into the wrong hands at some point
